author: OKFN
name: dfid-project-database
notes:
Database of all aid projects funded by DfID. Acts as a publicly accessable face of the private DfID ARIES database.
## Details
The Department for International Development (DfID) is the part of the UK government that manages Britain's aid to poor countries and works to get rid of extreme poverty.
The project database acts as a public front to the private ARIES database which contains all information on DfID's activities.
IT was developed to fall in line with the 2005 Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness and the 2008 Accra Agenda for Action.

extras.value: Run a blank search to pull up all projects then you can export them to Excel.

Project component code, Project title, Description, Stage, Start date, End date, Risk, Continent/country, Sector group/sector(s), Nature of funding, Source of Funding, Are conditions attached, Cross cutting objective: Gender Equality, Cross cutting objective: HIV/AIDS, Use of partner country public financial management systems, Are partner country procurement systems used?, Use of programme based approaches, Total lifetime approved budget, Actual expenditure to date, yearly budget and expenditure
